column1: #Text=What lost a world , and bade a hero fly ?
#Text=Yet be the soft triumvir 's fault forgiven , By this , how many lose -- not earth -- but heaven !
#Text=Consign their souls to man 's eternal foe , And seal their own , to spare some wanton 's , woe !

#Text=I soon returned to Manon ; and to prevent the servants from having any suspicion , I told her in their hearing , that she need not expect M. G -- -- M -- -- to supper ; that he was most reluctantly occupied with business which detained him , and that he had commissioned me to come and make his excuses , and to fill his place at the supper table ; which , in the company of so beautiful a lady , I could not but consider a very high honour .
#Text=She seconded me with her usual adroitness .

#Text=I put on the most serious air I could assume , while the servants were in the room , and at length having got rid of them , we passed , beyond all comparison , the most agreeable evening of my life .
#Text=I gave Marcel orders to find a hackney-coach , and engage it to be at the gate on the following morning a little before six o'clock .

#Text=I pretended to take leave of Manon about midnight , but easily gaining admission again , through Marcel , I proceeded to occupy G -- -- M -- -- 's bed , as I had filled his place at the supper table .

#Text= G -- -- M -- -- was followed by a servant , when he was stopped by my friend the guardsman .
